newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Horse racing-Waterhouse ban appeal upheld.
newsitem.headline: Horse racing-Waterhouse ban appeal upheld.

text.p: Racehorse trainer Gai Waterhouse said on Tuesday she was keen to get on with preparations for the Melbourne spring carnival after an Australian Jockey Club Committee (AJC) upheld her appeal against a three-month ban.

The AJC committee met for the second day on Tuesday before deciding to uphold Waterhouse's appeal against the ban, imposed after an inquiry into the handling of the galloper Gossips in the Shannon Quality Handicap at Rosehill on September 21.
The same AJC committee rejected a similar appeal by Gossips' jockey, Kevin Forrester, but reduced his ban by a month to two months.
"I feel relieved and very happy," Waterhouse told reporters.
"I knew that I was innocent but unfortunately you are guilty until proven otherwise.
"It has been very traumatic, a cloud hanging over me, but it hasn't impacted on the carnival preparations of my horses," she said.
Waterhouse is training a large team of horses for Melbourne's spring carnival. One of her charges, Juggler, is favourite for Saturday's A$1.5 million Cox Plate at Moonee Valley.
